au_211136: # Manually start the module-loopback.
pactl load-module module-loopback

# Configure your system to load module-loopback on startup.
# This places load-module module-loopback at the end of
# the /etc/pulse/default.pa pulseaudio configuration file.
sudo sh -c ' echo "load-module module-loopback" >>  /etc/pulse/default.pa '

Answers.MP Summary: command-line sound recorder and player for ALSA soundcard driver
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: List all sound cards and digital audio devices
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_43319199: How to loop back the microphone entry directly to speakers on linux?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_43319199: arecord | aplay

arecord -l

arecord -Dhw:<card_num>,<device_num> -c <channel_number> –f <format> -r <sample_rate> | aplay -Dhw:<card_num>,<device_num>

Explanations about Options.-r:
Sampling rate in Hertz. The default rate is 8000 Hertz. If the value specified is
 less than 300, it is taken as the rate in kilohertz. Valid values are 2000 through
 192000 Hertz.
Explanations about Options.-c:
The number of channels. The default is one channel. Valid values are 1 through
 32.
